name: South Kinsman Mountain

trails_config.name: Mount Kinsman Trail
trails_config.description: A classic approach from the west. Passes through beautiful hardwood forests and the rocky outlook of Bald Peak before reaching the high twin summits.
trails_config.parking_info: Mount Kinsman Trailhead, NH-116, Easton, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4358 feet, South Kinsman Mountain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4358 feet, South Kinsman Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Mount Kinsman Trail**, a **10.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
